alert.note: Alert for Somerset; Waldo (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 23 at 8:37PM EST until further notice by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Portions of Maine, including the following counties, Androscoggin, Cumberland, Franklin, Kennebec, Oxford, Somerset and Waldo. Portions of northern New Hampshire, including the following counties, Carroll and Coos. * WHEN...Until 400 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 834 PM EST, Up to 3 inches of rain has fallen in some areas. Additional runoff will continue overnight. - Even though the rain has ended, some small creeks and streams will continue to rise until after midnight, before they start to recede. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Auburn, Waterville, Farmington, Fairfield, Bridgton, Fryeburg, Mechanic Falls, Bethel, Turner, and Rumford.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
